page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF NORTH WHEATLEY TO THE EAST OF THE GRID IS A MIXTURE OF THE OLD AND THE NEW. THE OLDER PROPERTIES MENTIONED EARLIER HAVE BEEN ADDED TO IN RECENT YEARS BY DEVELOPERS WHO HAVE BUILT HOUSES FOR PEOPLE WHO COME TO LIVE IN THE MORE RURAL SURROUNDINGS. THE EASE OF TRANSPORT HAS ENCOURAGED MANY PEOPLE TO COME INTO THE VILLAGE. THEY TEND TO USE THE VILLAGE AS A BASE AND TRAVEL OUTSIDE TO WORK IN THE LARGER TOWNS. THE POPULATION TENDS TO BE STABLE AND THE OLD AND NEWER MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY GELL TOGETHER WELL. HAYTON IS A MORE RECENT DEVELOPMENT BEING CONSTRUCTED ALONG A MINOR ROAD TO THE VILLAGE OF CLAYWORTH.PROPERTY HERE IS OF VARYING AGE AND IS OCCUPIED BY OLDER RESIDENTS AND NEWER MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY WHO ALSO WORK IN THE NEARBY TOWNS.
